From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To display the ROM monitor (ROMMON) status, use the **show rom-monitor** command in user EXEC or privileged EXEC mode.

ParaDef.Info: Displays the slot number of the ROMMON for which the status is to be displayed.
Displays the ROMMON status of the switch processor.
Displays the ROMMON status of the route processor.

Examples: Currently running ROMMON from F1 region
ExtraInfo: When you enter the **show rom-monitor slot** command, the output displays the following:•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)Region region1 and region2—Displays the status of the ROMMON image and the order of preference from which the region1 or region2 images should be booted. The ROMMON image status values are as follows:–![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)First run—Indicates that a check of the new image is being run.–![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)Invalid—Indicates that the new image has been checked and the upgrade process has started.–![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)Approved—Indicates that the ROMMON field upgrade process has completed.•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)Currently running—This field displays the currently running image and the region.The **sp** or **rp** keyword is required only if a supervisor engine is installed in the specified slot.

RelatedCmds.description: Sets the execution preference on a ROMMON.
